com.delphix.masking.api.plugin.utils

Class MaskValueMetadataImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.delphix.masking.api.plugin.utils.MaskValueMetadataImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MaskValueMetadata

    public class MaskValueMetadataImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements MaskValueMetadata
    This class provides an implementation of the MaskValueMetadata interface. This class allows the use of builder pattern methods to set the various metadata field values.
    Since:
    1.4.0

      • getStringMaxLength

        public int getStringMaxLength()
        Description copied from interface: MaskValueMetadata
        Get the maximum length of String that will fit in the field. This method is now an alias for getMaxLength, with the exception that values greater than Integer.MAX_VALUE are reported as Integer.MAX_VALUE.
        Specified by:
        getStringMaxLength in interface MaskValueMetadata
        Returns:
        The maximum length of the masked String.

      • isStringMaxLengthEncoded

        public boolean isStringMaxLengthEncoded()
        Description copied from interface: MaskValueMetadata
        Get a boolean value indicating whether the value returned by MaskValueMetadata.getStringMaxLength() method represents the maximum Java String length in characters (false), or a byte length limit that should be applied to the encoded String (true).
        Specified by:
        isStringMaxLengthEncoded in interface MaskValueMetadata
        Returns:

      • getMaskingType

        public MaskingAlgorithm.MaskingType getMaskingType()
        Description copied from interface: MaskValueMetadata
        Get the MaskingAlgorithm.MaskingType type of the values being masked. This information is provided to allow ADVANCED_OBJECT type algorithms to determine the underlying object type for values being masked.
        Specified by:
        getMaskingType in interface MaskValueMetadata
        Returns:
        The type of value being masked

      • getStorageType

        public UnderlyingDataType getStorageType()
        Description copied from interface: MaskValueMetadata

        Get the UnderlyingDataType value indicating the storage type of the value masked. This information more precisely reflects storage type of the value than MaskingType. The result will be null when this information is not available.

        The special values MaskValueMetadata.UNKNOWN_LENGTH_SENTINEL and MaskValueMetadata.UNLIMITED_LENGTH_SENTINEL represent special case values for maximum length. Presence of these sentinels typically means no length restriction will be applied to the mask value.

        Specified by:
        getStorageType in interface MaskValueMetadata
        Returns:
        The storage type of value being masked

      • getMaxLength

        public long getMaxLength()
        Description copied from interface: MaskValueMetadata
        Get the maximum size of the value being masked. The max length will be set if known for all storage types. For string types, this be either the number of characters, or the number of byte of storage available, depending on whether MaskValueMetadata.isStringMaxLengthEncoded() returns true.
        Specified by:
        getMaxLength in interface MaskValueMetadata
        Returns:
        The maximum length of the masked value

      • getNumericPrecision

        public int getNumericPrecision()
        Description copied from interface: MaskValueMetadata

        Get the numeric precision, in digits, of the field. This is the maximum number of base 10 digits that can be store in the field without rounding. This value is approximate when storageType is LONG or DOUBLE, and indicates the number of full decimal digits the field can carry. For example, a 16-bit integer will show value of 4, since the values from 32,768 - 99,999 cannot be represented.

        This value is undefined for storage types other than BIG_DECIMAL, LONG and DOUBLE.

        A value of 0 will be returned if the numeric precision is known

        Specified by:
        getNumericPrecision in interface MaskValueMetadata
        Returns:
        The base numeric precision of the field

      • dateFormat

        public MaskValueMetadataImpl dateFormat(java.lang.String dateFormatIn)
        Set the Date Format string used to construct the DateTimeFormatter. The DEFAULT_DATE_TIME_SENTINEL value may be used to reset to the default format.
        Parameters:
        dateFormatIn - The new date format, which should be compatible with DateTimeFormatterBuilder.appendPattern(java.lang.String)
        Returns:
        The MaskValueMetadataImpl object

      • markReadOnly

        public MaskValueMetadataImpl markReadOnly()
        Mark this object read-only. The MaskValueMetadata objects retrieved by algorithms are read-only. Calling this method marks this read-only to prevent modification. It is generally not useful to call this method in the context of an algorithm implementation.
        Returns:
        The MaskValueMetadataImpl object
